### Multi-Objective Particle Swarm Optimization

##### Reference: Coello C ,  Pulido G T ,  Lechuga M S . Handling multiple objectives with particle swarm optimization[J]. IEEE Transactions on Evolutionary Computation.

The particle swarm optimization for the global multi-objective optimization

| Variables  | Meaning                                                      |
| ---------- | ------------------------------------------------------------ |
| pop        | The population size                                          |
| iter       | The iteration number                                         |
| nrep       | The repository size                                          |
| ngrid      | The grid number on each dimension                            |
| omega      | Inertia weight                                               |
| c1         | Personal learning coefficient                                |
| c2         | Global learning coefficient                                  |
| alpha      | The inflation rate of grid                                   |
| beta       | The pressure of global best selection                        |
| gamma      | The pressure of deletion selection                           |
| mu         | Mutation rate                                                |
| lb         | The lower bound (list)                                       |
| ub         | The upper bound (list)                                       |
| vmin       | The minimum velocity (list)                                  |
| vmax       | The maximum velocity (list)                                  |
| dim        | The dimension of the objective function                      |
| pos        | The position of particles                                    |
| score      | The score of particles                                       |
| vel        | The velocity of particles                                    |
| p_best     | The personal best score of each particle                     |
| p_best_pos | The position of personal best                                |
| rep        | The repository to store the position of all non-dominated particles |
| rep_score  | The repository to store the score of all non-dominated particles |
| grid       | The grid on the objective space                              |
| rep_index  | The grid index of each element in repository                 |
| g_best_pos | The global best particle to guide the global learning of particles |

#### Test problem: ZDT3



$$
\left\{
\begin{aligned}
&f_1(x)=x_1\\
&f_2(x)=g(x)\left[1-\sqrt{x_1/g(x)}-\frac{x_1}{g(x)}\sin(10\pi x_1)\right]\\
&f_3(x)=1+9\left(\sum_{i=2}^nx_i\right)/(n-1)\\
&x_i\in[0, 1], \qquad i=1,\cdots,n
\end{aligned}
\right.
$$



#### Example

```python
if __name__ == '__main__':
    pop = 200
    iter = 100
    nrep = 100
    ngrid = 7
    omega = 0.5
    c1 = 1
    c2 = 2
    alpha = 0.1
    beta = 2
    gamma = 2
    mu = 0.1
    lb = [0] * 5
    ub = [1] * 5
    vmin = [(lb[i] - ub[i]) * 0.15 for i in range(len(lb))]
    vmax = [(ub[i] - lb[i]) * 0.15 for i in range(len(lb))]
    print(main(pop, iter, nrep, ngrid, omega, c1, c2, alpha, beta, gamma, mu, lb, ub, vmin, vmax))
```
